pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:5.1: 73. The training rule on defecating while standing
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were defecating and urinating while standing. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:7.2: “‘When not sick, I will not defecate or urinate while standing,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:8.1: If one is not sick, one should not defecate or urinate while standing.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:8.2: If, out of disrespect, a monk who is not sick defecates or urinates while standing, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:9.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:9.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:10.1: The thirteenth training rule is finished.
